Description: Neck of a large black-figure painted pottery situla, reconstructed from eight fragments. Designs black on deep buff ground, with incised lines and purple accessories. B, two birds (falcons) perched on a floral ornament. Purple on forepart of wing and alternate petals of floral.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 17
Curator's comments: Findspot determined by Petrie 1888, pl. xxv,1 Petrie 1888, pl. xxv,1(part of B); BMC B.106.2 (B only). Reconstructed with BM GR 1888,0208.27. Cook's group C2. Cook 1952, 34: "Though the fragments do not all join, they pretty certainly come from one pot: anyhow the left part of A joins the right part of B"
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.2)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 601, 3-4 (and GB 597, 8))
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 63, pl. xxv, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 242)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.207)
